alfredsnippet.snippet:
Marilyn Ferguson, The Aquarian Conspiracy. (See Kronos VII, 1, 1981, p.42)

"Sooner or later, if human society is to evolve -- indeed if it is to survive -- we must match our lives to our new knowledge. For too long, the Two Cultures -- the aesthetic, feeling humanities and cool, analytical science -- have functioned independently, like the right and left hemispheres of a split-brain patient. We have been the victims of our collective divided consciousness."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - The Unification of the Humanities and Analytical Science
